result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J. Braatz

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[MK[ cases #22CF394, #22CM206, #22CM240, #22CM245  called at 9:39am 
Defendant Christopher J Braatz does not appear. Attorney Joseph Fischer in court. ADA Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance.
Attorney Fischer provides information that Mr. Braatz is currently at an inpatient treatment facility; he had expected Mr. Braatz to appear by Zoom-video today. 
recess 9:42am (for Attorney Fischer to makes contacts in an effort to have Mr. Braatz appear) 
reconvene 9:55am Defendant Christopher Braatz now appears by Zoom videoconference. 
The Court finds the Zoom video-conection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Arraignment is held in Case #22CF394:
--Service of Information admitted; reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.  
--Pleas of "Not guilty" are entered as to all counts.  
--In response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial. 
recess 10:01am 

NEXT:  Status Conference on December 1st at 2:30pm

Order for Zoom appearance at 10/06/22 hearing

ec: DA and Atty Fischer (10/5/22--ma)
Proposed Order for Zoom appearance at 10/06/22 hearing
Stip for Zoom appearance at 10/06/22 hearing
Bond Payment Information
Req. denied.wvg
Proposed Order Modifying Bond
Stipulation Modifying Bond
Arraignment on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[MK] case called at 1:06pm
Defendant Christopher J. Braatz in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.  
Mr. Braatz waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
ADA Shock requests that arraignment be scheduled on a later date. 
As to Mr. Braatz's letter regarding bond, Attorney Fischer indicates that he iis working toward finalizing a written stipulation regarding bond. 
recess 1:11pm

NEXT:   Arraignment on October 6th at 9:30am
Court's Response to Defendant's 9/1/22 Letter
Scheduling Order
Letter from defendant requesting bail reduction
Transcript from 8/30/2022 initial appearance
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 1:16pm 
Defendant Christopher J. Braatz appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance.  

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit, as requested by the Defense.

The Court requires a $50,000 Cash Bond with conditions:
--absolutely no contact with Victim 1 or with Victim 1's minor children
--no presence at the Arlington Way address in Watertown
--no discussion of the facts of the case with family members
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--not to possess any firearms or ammunition
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin
--Mr. Braatz is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.** 
recess 1:40pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing (10 day time limit applies) on September 8th at 1:00pm
